RACE.RACE_TEXT: FORT ERIE RACE 1 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 80. Starter Optional Claiming Purse 21300. FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE STARTED FOR A CLAIMING PRICE OF $5,000 OR LESS SINCE SEPTEMBER 26, 2021 OR CLAIMING PRICE $10,000. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since August 26 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $10,000, if for $9,000, allowed 2 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $8,000 Or Less Not Considered In Allowances) (*Plus Up To $540 Ontario Bred/Ontario Sired Breeders Awards).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: BODACIOUS MISS showed speed from the outside, had a clear lead on the turn and with mild pressure in mid stretch prevailed. SIMPLE SOUVENIR stalked the early leader and was a factor on the turn but from the three path at the top of the stretch was no match for the winner. BORN TO BE GOOD was in touch and roused on the turn but from the four path at the top of the stretch needed more. PLUIE D'AVRIL was in range and raced evenly on the turn but had no late kick. ANITA GRIGIO was off the pace, trailed throughout and was not a factor.

ENTRY.NAME: Simple Souvenir
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked leader, factor turn, 3-path stretch, no match

ENTRY.NAME: Born to Be Good
ENTRY.OWNER: Roberto Joseph I and Cathcart Steven
ENTRY.COMMENT: in touch, roused turn, 4-path stretch, needed more

ENTRY.NAME: Anita Grigio
ENTRY.COMMENT: off pace, trailed throughout, not a factor

ENTRY.NAME: Pluie d'Avril
ENTRY.COMMENT: in range, evenly turn, no late kick

ENTRY.NAME: Bodacious Miss
ENTRY.OWNER: Voyce Jeff and McGirr Jr Herbert
ENTRY.COMMENT: speed outside, clear lead turn, mild pressure stretch, prevailed

RACE.RACE_TEXT: FORT ERIE RACE 2 5 1/2F Dirt CR: 60. Claiming Purse 13500. FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since September 3 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $4,000 (*Plus Up To $540 Ontario Bred/Ontario Sired Breeders Awards).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: SO BREANNA was unhurried early, moved up from the inside on the turn and with a bid in mid stretch drew clear. MISS LINDYSUE was hustled early, had a slim lead on the turn, vied from the three path at the top of the stretch and held place. ONLY BELIEVE was away alertly but trailed the field on the turn and was up for show. VERI UNIFIED was in touch, a factor on the turn and had the lead from the five path in mid stretch but gave way. FOREST CHOICE was up close and forced the pace on the turn but from the four path at the top of the stretch weakened late.

ENTRY.NAME: Miss Lindysue
ENTRY.COMMENT: hustled early, slim lead turn, vied 3-path stretch, held place

ENTRY.NAME: Only Believe
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, trailed turn, up for show

ENTRY.NAME: Veri Unified
ENTRY.COMMENT: in touch, factor turn, led 5-path stretch, gave way

ENTRY.NAME: So Breanna
ENTRY.OWNER: Beclawat Stable and Pereira Zona L
ENTRY.COMMENT: unhurried, moved up inside turn, bid stretch, drew clear

ENTRY.NAME: Forest Choice
ENTRY.COMMENT: up close, forced pace turn, 4-path stretch, weakened late

RACE.RACE_TEXT: FORT ERIE RACE 3 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 79. Claiming Purse 13500. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NOT WON A RACE IN 2023 OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON FOUR RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Claiming Price $4,000 (Colts And Geldings Preferred)(*Plus Up To $540 Ontario Bred/Ontario Sired Breeders Award s).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: LETTING LOOSE was up close, had a slim lead on the turn and from the three path at the top of the stretch proved best. LOQUACIOUS was unhurried early, moved up on the turn and from the five path at the top of the stretch was second best. RADCLIFFE was away alertly and forced the pace on the turn but from the four path at the top of the stretch had nothing left. BOCELLI was off the pace, trailed the field on the turn and from the four path at the top of the stretch was up for a share. BIG BROWN BREWSKII was in range and roused from the inside on the turn but had no response. BE THE CHANGE was in touch but chased on the turn and from the six path at the top of the stretch faded late.

ENTRY.NAME: Bocelli
ENTRY.COMMENT: off pace, trailed turn, 4-path stretch, up for share

ENTRY.NAME: Loquacious
ENTRY.COMMENT: unhurried, moved up turn, 5-path stretch, 2nd best

ENTRY.NAME: Letting Loose
ENTRY.COMMENT: up close, slim lead turn, 3-path stretch, proved best

ENTRY.NAME: Be the Change
ENTRY.COMMENT: in touch, chased turn, 6-path stretch, faded late

ENTRY.NAME: Radcliffe
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, forced pace turn, 4-path stretch, nothing left

ENTRY.NAME: Big Brown Brewskii
ENTRY.COMMENT: in range, roused inside turn, no response

RACE.RACE_TEXT: FORT ERIE RACE 4 7F Turf CR: 64. Claiming Purse 19800. FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since September 2 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $6,250, if for $6,000, allowed 2 lbs. (Races Where Entered F or $5,000 Or Less Not Considered In Allowances) (Limited To 10 Starters)(*Plus Up To $540 Ontario Bred/Ontario Sired Breeders Awards). If deemed inadvisable by management to run on the turf, this race will be run at a distance of Six and One Half Furlongs on the main track.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: SMARTY ILLUSION was in touch, moved up on the far turn and from the three path at the top of the stretch was kept to task. MIZZ GEMMA was well back early, closed the gap on the far turn and from the four path at the top of the stretch finished well. HEAR ME KNOCKING was hustled early and had a slim lead on the far turn but gave way at the top of the stretch. ORIGINAL ME was in range and raced evenly on the far turn but from the seven path at the top of the stretch had no late kick. TOTAL BETTY was away alertly and a factor on the far turn but from the six path at the top of the stretch leveled off. LUNATICA was off the pace, showed little and was never a threat. WHATSWRONGWITHYOU tracked the early leaders and dueled on the far turn but from the five path at the top of the stretch was empty.

ENTRY.NAME: Mizz Gemma
ENTRY.COMMENT: well back, closed gap far turn, 4-path stretch, finished well

ENTRY.NAME: Smarty Illusion
ENTRY.OWNER: Cunningham, Walter E. and Pion, Terri L.
ENTRY.COMMENT: in touch, moved up far turn, 3-path stretch, kept to task

ENTRY.NAME: Hear Me Knocking
ENTRY.OWNER: Capi Louie M and Ramjattan Christina
ENTRY.COMMENT: hustled early, slim lead far turn, gave way top stretch

ENTRY.NAME: Total Betty
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, factor far turn, 6-path stretch, leveled off

ENTRY.NAME: Whatswrongwithyou
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked leaders, dueled far turn, 5-path stretch, empty

ENTRY.NAME: Lunatica
ENTRY.COMMENT: off pace, showed little, never a threat

ENTRY.NAME: Original Me
ENTRY.OWNER: Keen Howard and Mills Christina Ann Marie
ENTRY.COMMENT: in range, evenly turn, 7-path stretch, no late kick

RACE.RACE_TEXT: FORT ERIE RACE 5 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 85. Claiming Purse 19800. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NOT WON TWO RACES IN 2023. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since September 3 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $6,250, if for $6,000, allowed 2 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $5,000 Or Less Not Considered In Eligibility) (Colts And Geldings Preferred)(*Plus Up To $540 Ontario Bred/Ontario Sired Breeders Awards).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: JACK BEANSTALK set the pace, took command on the turn and from the three path at the top of the stretch was much the best. MONEY MATTERS stalked the early leader and was a factor on the turn but from the four path at the top of the stretch was outfinished. BEN LOMOND was in touch and had a mild gain on the turn but from the five path at the top of the stretch leveled off. WENJACK was unhurried early and saved ground on the turn but from the three path at the top of the stretch was no real threat. DE ONLY SOLUTION was away alertly, showed little and from the five path at the top of the stretch was outrun. BEYOND MY DREAMS was off the pace and hustled along on the turn but from the six path at the top of the stretch was not a factor.

ENTRY.NAME: Wenjack
ENTRY.COMMENT: unhurried, saved ground turn, 3-path stretch, no real threat

ENTRY.NAME: Jack Beanstalk
ENTRY.COMMENT: set pace, took command turn, 3-path stretch, much the best

ENTRY.NAME: Ben Lomond
ENTRY.COMMENT: in touch, mild gain turn, 5-path stretch, leveled off

ENTRY.NAME: De Only Solution
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, showed little, 5-path stretch, outrun

ENTRY.NAME: Money Matters
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked leader, factor turn, 4-path stretch, outfinished

ENTRY.NAME: Beyond My Dreams
ENTRY.COMMENT: off pace, hustled along turn, 6-path stretch, not a factor

RACE.RACE_TEXT: FORT ERIE RACE 6 7F Turf CR: 79. Claiming Purse 15750. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since September 3 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000, if for $4,750, allowed 2 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $4,000 Or Less Not Considered In Allowances) (Colts And Geldings Preferred)(Limited to 10 Starters)(*Plus Up To $540 Ontario Bred/Ontario Sired Breeders Awards). If deemed inadvisable by management to run on the turf, this race will be run at a distance of Six and OneH alf Furlongs on the main track.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: SYNCHROMESH was unhurried early, dueled on the far turn and with the lead from the four path at the top of the stretch held safe. KODIAK MAMBA (IRE) settled off the early leaders, saved ground on the far turn and rallied late. TWO YEAR CONTRACT set the pace and had a slim lead on the far turn but from the three path at the top of the stretch gave way. FIFTH SEASON stalked the early leader and raced evenly on the far turn but from the four path at the top of the stretch needed more. BOX N SCORE was off the pace and roused on the far turn but from the five path at the top of the stretch had no late kick.

ENTRY.NAME: Kodiak Mamba (IRE)
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled off leaders, saved ground far turn, rallied late

ENTRY.NAME: Two Year Contract
ENTRY.COMMENT: set pace, slim lead far turn, 3-path stretch, gave way

ENTRY.NAME: Fifth Season
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked leader, evenly far turn, 4-path stretch, needed more

ENTRY.NAME: Box N Score
ENTRY.COMMENT: off pace, roused turn, 5-path stretch, no late kick

ENTRY.NAME: Synchromesh
ENTRY.COMMENT: unhurried, dueled far turn, led 4-path stretch, held safe

RACE.RACE_TEXT: FORT ERIE RACE 7 1 1/8M Dirt CR: 85. Starter Optional Claiming Purse 24600. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE STARTED FOR A CLAIMING PRICE OF $10,000 OR LESS SINCE OCTOBER 3, 2021 OR CLAIMING PRICE $12,500. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race At A Mile Or Over Since September 3 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $12,500, if for $12,000, allowed 2 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $10,000 Or Less Not Considered In Allowances) (Colts And Geldings Preferred)(*Plus Up To $810 Ontario Bred/Ontario Sired Breeders Awards).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: KIDDIE HOLIDAY was unhurried early, had the lead on the far turn and widened under light handling through the stretch. ANTIGONE stalked the early leader and had a good position on the far turn but was no match for the winner. REDOUTE'S LIGHT was well back, closed the gap on the far turn and from the three path at the top of the stretch was up for show. A I INITIATIVE was off the pace and moved up on the far turn but from the six path at the top of the stretch needed more. TRISH THE DISH set the pace and was a factor on the far turn but from the three path at the top of the stretch had nothing left. PAPERBACK HERO was in range and roused on the far urn but from the five path at the top of the stretch had no response. DOODLE DANDY showed no speed and had a mild gain on the far turn but from the five path at the top of the stretch had no rally. SANTIAGO SALSA was in touch but chased on the far turn and came up empty. SAILOR'S PASSION was in mid pack but lost ground on the far turn and was not a factor.

ENTRY.NAME: Trish the Dish
ENTRY.COMMENT: set pace, factor far turn, 3-path stretch, nothing left

ENTRY.NAME: Antigone
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked leader, good position far turn, no match

ENTRY.NAME: Redoute's Light
ENTRY.COMMENT: well back, closed gap far turn, 3-path stretch, up for show

ENTRY.NAME: Santiago Salsa
ENTRY.COMMENT: in touch, chased far turn, came up empty

ENTRY.NAME: Doodle Dandy
ENTRY.OWNER: Hoad Lindsey L and Hoad Joseph B
ENTRY.COMMENT: no speed, mild gain far turn, 5-path stretch, no rally

ENTRY.NAME: Kiddie Holiday
ENTRY.COMMENT: unhurried, led far turn, widened under light handling

ENTRY.NAME: Paperback Hero
ENTRY.COMMENT: in range, roused far turn, 5-path stretch, no response

ENTRY.NAME: Sailor's Passion
ENTRY.OWNER: Fournier Mark and Leith Scott Andrew
ENTRY.COMMENT: mid pack, lost ground far turn, not a factor

ENTRY.NAME: A I Initiative
ENTRY.COMMENT: off pace, moved up far turn, 6-path stretch, needed more

RACE.RACE_TEXT: FORT ERIE RACE 8 7F Turf CR: 65. Maiden Claiming Purse 15000. FOR MAIDENS, FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 122 lbs. Claiming Price $4,000, if for $3,750, allowed 2 lbs. (Limited to 10 Starters)(*Plus Up To $540 Ontario Bred/Ontario Sired Breeders Awards). If deemed in advisable by management to run on the turf, this race will be run at a distance of Six and One Half Furlongs on the main track.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: IMPOSSIBLE BERTIE set the pace, had a slim lead on the far turn, vied through the stretch and fought gamely for the win. TANGERINE TWIST stalked the early leader and forced the pace on the far turn but from the three path at the top of the stretch was outgunned. ASHWICKEN was off the pace and moved up on the far turn but from the four path at the top of the stretch was outfinished. LADY OF THE FORT was in touch and raced evenly on the far turn but had no late kick. RUMOURS FLY was unhurried early and roused from between foes on the far turn but from the four path at the top of the stretch needed more. PRINCESS DIDI settled off the pace and saved ground on the far turn but was no threat. KIMONO KATE was in range but chased on the far turn and from the six path at the top of the stretch failed to fire. WICKEN CENTS was well back and closed the gap on the far turn but from the seven path at the top of the stretch had no impact. SPEEDY NEPHRITE was in mid pack early but lost ground on the far turn, was outdistanced and walked off.

ENTRY.NAME: Impossible Bertie
ENTRY.COMMENT: set pace, slim lead far turn, vied stretch, fought gamely

ENTRY.NAME: Princess Didi
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled off pace, saved ground far turn, no threat

ENTRY.NAME: Rumours Fly
ENTRY.COMMENT: unhurried, roused between far turn, 4-path stretch, needed more

ENTRY.NAME: Wicken Cents
ENTRY.COMMENT: well back, closed gap far turn, 7-path stretch, no impact

ENTRY.NAME: Lady of the Fort
ENTRY.COMMENT: in touch, evenly far turn, no late kick

ENTRY.NAME: Ashwicken
ENTRY.COMMENT: off pace, moved up far turn, 4-path stretch, outfinished

ENTRY.NAME: Kimono Kate
ENTRY.COMMENT: in range, chased far urn, 6-path stretch, failed to fire

ENTRY.NAME: Speedy Nephrite
ENTRY.COMMENT: mid pack, lost ground far turn, outdistanced, walked off

ENTRY.NAME: Tangerine Twist
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked leader, forced pace far turn, 3-path stretch, outgunned
